clinical_study.brief_title: Implant-Associated P. Aeruginosa Bone And Joint Infections : Experience In A Regional Reference Center In France
clinical_study.official_title: Implant-Associated P. Aeruginosa Bone And Joint Infections : Experience In A Regional Reference Center In France

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to describe the bone or joint infection due to Pseudomonas aeruginosa in patients having implant.

primary_outcome.measure: Description and rate of bone or joint infection on implant caused due to Pseudomonas aeruginosa
primary_outcome.time_frame: Outcome is measured at the end of follow-up (usually between 12 and 24 months after antibiotic therapy disruption)
primary_outcome.description: Description of the type of infection due to P. aeruginosa : patients and type of implant, profile of the bacterium, medical and chirurgical treatment, rate

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of adverse events occurring under medical treatment against Pseudomonas aeruginosa
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Outcome is measured at the end of follow-up (usually between 12 and 24 months after antibiotic therapy disruption)
secondary_outcome.description: description of adverse events occurring under medical treatment against Pseudomonas aeruginosa in BJI

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Outcome is measured at the end of follow-up (usually between 12 and 24 months after antibiotic therapy disruption)
secondary_outcome.description: Treatment failure is defined by local clinical and/or microbiological relapse; and/or need for additional surgery; death of septic origin
